Manager.title: Crashes on l preview

Manager.description: Hi and great work !! I used Twidere since January (I think) and after re-mod ing my phone I can not install it again. Market says "This app is incompatible with your device". But in your README file it says "Twidere is a powerful twitter client for Android 1.6+" and "There're two versions, one for Android 4.0+, another for Android 1.6 to Android 3.2". How can I install the proper version to my android phone ? I have Android 2.3.7 (CyanogeMod-7.2.0) and Kernel 2.6.35.7 (as my phone's info says) regards
Manager.title: Twidere for Android 2.3.7

Manager.description: Something the original Twitter app has that I'd love to see in Twidere is the link to view all of a user's photos on their profile page. I'd rather not page through a user's tweets to find the photo posts. That feature would make Twidere perfect for me.
Manager.title: Enhancement suggestion: View user's photos.

Manager.description: The status view breaks if you have Refresh on start enabled. You can not show the conversation and the 'loading icon' is hanging. If you disable Refresh on start, it instantly works again.
Manager.title: Status view and 'Refresh on start'

Manager.description: Hello, twitter official client replaced the mentions tab with a notifications tab which also lets the user know if one of their tweets have been favourited, or someone has retweeted a tweet in which they are mentioned etc... is it possible to bring this functionality to twidere? 👍 2
Manager.title: [Feature request] Favourited/retweeted notifications

Manager.description: Twitter gave a heads-up that they will allow DirectMessages up to 10k characters in length in July. This would mean some UI changes for sending a DM, as well as a minor API call modification when receiving DMs via REST. https://twittercommunity.com/t/removing-the-140-character-limit-from-direct-messages/41348 REST API DM read endpoints (GET direct_messages, GET direct_messages/sent and GET direct_messages/show) Send “full_text=true” as a query parameter to receive long DM text. If this parameter is not provided, you will get a truncated version of the DM. There will be no structural changes to the response returned by these endpoints. DM write endpoint (POST direct_messages/new) The “text” parameter will start accepting text longer than 140 characters. The new limit for DMs will be 10k characters. Streaming API User Streams (GET user) and Site Streams (GET site) will automatically start receiving DMs that have text longer than 140 characters. Unlike the REST API, no additional parameter is needed. There will be no structural changes to the objects returned by these endpoints.
Manager.title: Preparing API calls and UI for longer DMs (Twitter feature change in July)

Manager.description: The ideal handling would be to have these icons justified, with ample space in between to show (perhaps) 3 digits. For anything longer than 3 digits it would suffice to show something like "2K+" or "1M+". This would serve to reduce UI clutter, and also misclicks due to a variable target size.

Manager.description: If a user's name contains RTL text (for example Arabic or Hebrew) Twidere displays the name incorrectly in timeline view: _example@ مثال rather than مثال @example_ For example: Here's how the Tweet is displayed on Twitter's mobile site: If we take a look at the user's page, you'll see that the user info box at the top is displaying the @ name correctly although the Arabic text is hidden behind the "Follow" button.
Manager.title: RTL text in username causes glitches

Manager.description: I'm trying to log in and I keep getting an error saying they "API URL or consumer key/secret may be incorrect". Manager.description: Android版本： 5.1.1 Twidere版本：0.3.0-dev160124 现象：登录时无法使用Socks代理登录 步骤： １.初次登陆时在登录界面点击齿轮按钮，进入网络，高级。 ２.选中代理服务器，代理类型为SOCKS，代理服务器主机名为 127.0.0.1 ，端口为 1080 （如下图）。 ３.返回后并尝试登录，提示失败，网络错误。 分析：通过 logcat 查看日志，代理或者解析功能并未通过SOCKS代理，Twidere通过一个被污染的IP地址进行访问。 附件： logcat.txt
Manager.title: Socks proxy function NOT working in 0.3.0-dev160124

Manager.description: Android版本：5.1.1 Twidere版本：0.3.0 (dev 2016-01-24) 连接方式：Twip Twip版本：Mar 30, 2015 Twip模式：O模式 现象： 当遇到可能的网络问题时（网速太慢或者API无响应），Twidere可能会进入刷新卡死状态，无法再次刷新，也无法停止刷新过程，只能强行结束Twidere后再尝试刷新。即使将超时时间缩短为5秒，一样无法解决该问题。 录像： https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Bh06rrh5m4 Logcat： 当该问题出现时，logcat里没有有效输出。
Manager.title: In network issue,The refresh will freeze,And timeout function has failed

Manager.description: This is release 2015-11-22. I noticed that it tries to move the accounts around when I select and deselect an account in the new tweet account selector. It's nice, but slightly buggy and superfluous. Say I have accounts 1 2 3 under each other, I click on 2 to activate it, it will reorder the accounts to show 3 2 1 and then slide 1 and 3 across so they go to the correct position.
Manager.title: New tweet account selector animation unnecessary

Manager.description: This is release 2015-11-22. If you have more than 3 accounts, the list is cropped by the new tweet window and has to be scrolled around to see more than just the 3 accounts that more or less fit in there. It might be a good idea to make the account list pop up above the new tweet window, seeing as how it cannot be dismissed by tapping "outside" of the list anyway. The list is kinda hard to see, especially when the base GUI is set to dark transparent. It might be better if the list comes up in a "window" in its own right.
Manager.title: New tweet account selector usability issues

Manager.description: This is release 2015-11-22 Due to the new tweet window being smaller than the screen and the tap event outside of it being handled, it is too easy to accidentally close the new tweet (and trigger the draft save event). I think it is enough that the window can be dismissed with the Back button.
Manager.title: New tweet window too easy to dismiss

Manager.description: Android版本：5.1.1 Twidere版本：0.3.0-dev160126 现象： 刷新时Twidere偶尔会崩溃，通过logcat分析，怀疑是由于DNS污染导致无法获取图片，返回了空URI后崩溃。具体情况详见Logcat： Logcat： logcat.txt
Manager.title: DNS pollution may crash Twidere

Manager.description: I have set up a GNU social and a Twitter account in Twidere and every time I try to load new messages (by swiping down when I'm at the top of the timeline), Twidere crashes with an entry like the following in the logs: 01-27 21:47:32.641 E/AndroidRuntime(18865): at org.mariotaku.twidere.util.AsyncTwitterWrapper$GetSavedSearchesTask.doInBackground(AsyncTwitterWrapper.java:602) After I have started Twidere again the new messages are visible. In addition to that the option to load missing messages between older ones works without this problem. The Twidere version is 0.3.0 (dev 2016-01-26) – some days ago I had the latest version from F-Droid with only a Twitter account set up and this also had worked just fine…
Manager.title: Twidere crashes when trying to fetch new messages

Manager.title: *#*#8943373#*#* - Accessing secret settings fails

Manager.description: When using GNU Social I read it is recommend to select the "Force using private APIs" options in the secret settings. So my questions are: Is this really necessary for GNU Social? In my case it also worked before doing so, so what are the advantages of enabling this setting? Generally: What does this setting do?
Manager.title: Secret settings: Force private API?

Manager.description: Especially for GNU Social it is important to have a configurable character limit. Actually in a secret UI you can change the character limit (if it works), but this is unfavourable, because this setting is global. So if you want to use GNU Social and Twitter at the same time with Twidere, you have to decide on one character limit. Therefore I suggest to move this option out of the secret settings and into the "account settings", so you can set one limit per account. When posting to multiple accounts you obviously have to manage the limit somehow too. So you might split the tweet/queet if it is too long or only allow the smaller character limit.
Manager.title: Make character limit configurable per account

Manager.description: Thought this might be interesting to know for @mariotaku: Twitter announced to change the rules on how to count characters in the coming months. Manager.title: Twitter will change the rules regarding character count.

I noticed in this build that one of the card designs is gone (the one I was using :( ) i started going through the settings screens. I can see white background and radio and cancel buttons and no readable text. P.S. Any reason the 'compact card design' option/view is gone in this build?

Manager.title: Remove cached retweets after disable user's retweets

Manager.description: Similar to #543 there is still the bug that no notifications are shown when a DM is coming in and the auomatic refresh time shows it. It did work before Version 3.1.6. There is also a 2nd bug: DM will only refresh within the autorefresh time, or (if the setting is set to refresh at start) with a restart of the app. Manual refresh (pulling down) is visually shown, but does nothing. This happens on different devices (Phone with Android 5.1, Tablet with Android 4.4) Still happens with Version: 3.1.12 Twitter for Android-API Keys are used.
Manager.title: BUG: No notification and no manual refresh possible with DM

Manager.description: I have the setting that I get audio feedback (special ringtone) when receiving tweets. I discovered the following: No Twidere-Notification area in Android is, Tweet comes in, Notification is shown, and the ringtone is played. If I let the notification now untouched, and a second notification comes in, sometimes the ringtone is played, sometimes not (the notification itself shows correct that there are 2 tweets). But: if you still don't touch the notification, now all audio notifications are gone if tweets come in (the notification itself shows correct that there are more tweets), till you remove the notification - then it starts like written above again. This happens on different devices (Phone with Android 5.1, Tablet with Android 4.4), with now 3.1.9, but also with the Versions before. If this is not a bug but a feature, please give us the option to receive audio feedback every time (I don't have always the devices near, and every audio notification reminds to look after - like gmails notify at first mail vs notify always, I prefer always). Still happens with Version: 3.1.12 Twitter for Android-API Keys are used.
Manager.title: BUG: Audio notification stops after having 2+ unread notifications

Regular tweets will open, just not main profile pages. I have already tried clearing the cache for Android and for Twidere. Neither of these fixes the issue. I am using version 3.1.7 from the F-Droid repository. Android Version: 6.0.1 Marshmallow --- specifically Cyanogenmod 13: 13.0-20160706-NIGHTLY-condor Moto E 1st Gen Kernel version 3.4.112

Manager.description: Hello, I have searched a lot in the web before thinking this is an issue so, sorry if this problem have been addressed or I'm doing something wrong. I've used Twidere with a Twitter account, never had a problem. Today I tried setting up GNUSocial accounts and I can't get the timeline displayed, any tweet. I've used two different accounts in two different nodes: quitter.es and quitter.se, always using Basic Auth and API URL like https://domain/api/ without suffix version, in this last step, I've tried /api, and /api/ Nevertheless, I can do all of the following stuff in the Twidere client. Publish tweet Publish tweet with picture See likes Search tweets Search users View groups I've also tried doing (which didn't work): Disabling the twitter account and setting up only the GNUSocial one In the "Home" tab, selecting only the GNUSocial account instead of "all actives" Stopping the app and empty the cache Any of these steps results in the timeline being displayed. I always have the "Slide down to update" message. My device: Motorola Moto G XT1032 (first gen), rooted, with CM12.1-20151017-NIGHTLY (Android 5.1.1)
Manager.title: Timeline doesn't appear for GNUSocial in 3.1.12

Manager.description: Twidere Version 3.1.12 with Twitter for Android API-Keys: I wanted to create a tweet with an Image - first uploaded the Image, wrote the Text - it used 136 chars, 4 are left (says Twidere). Wanted to send it - tweet not possible. Made the same procedure in Twitter Webclient: 180 chars used, 40 over the limit. Deleted the Image, then I had my 136 chars. Somehow Twidere doesn't count the chars needed for the Image. In previous Versions (latest working was IIRC 3.1.9) this was not a problem (Images - the URL - where counted correct, and I could get to the max. 140 chars)
Manager.title: BUG: Tweet not possible - wrong character count

Manager.description: I don't know what to do in this popup window, pressing OK again and again until I finally found this window is scrollable... Possible solutions: Make the window slightly larger. Place the OK button within the bottom of the scroll area.

Manager.description: I experienced this on my phone (Moto G 1Gen, Android 5.1): suddenly at starting the program (after a couple of weeks normal working) the twitter login infos, and also some settings (most visible: all tabs) getting lost. It happens with Twidere 3.1.12, but happened also in the last 2-3 previous versions - with both login possibilities. Not all settings are gone: as I use the API-Key of the Twitter-Android client, this key is still there. Funny fact: the same Twidere version with the same Twitter account works parallel on a Android 4.4.2 tablet, and there this"loss" doesn't happen. My workaround now is to import all (previous exported) settings, and login into Twitter again every time this happens.
Manager.title: BUG: Suddenly login and tabs getting lost.

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Create new tweet. Fill in text. Click "Drafts" button to the left of the submit button. Click back button in the top-left corner of the activity. Expected: new tweet is saved as a draft. Actual: new tweet is deleted.
Manager.title: [BUG] New tweet is deleted if drafts are opened and back button is clicked

Manager.description: Hi, I'm worried this has to do with the limits Twitter had decided to artificially impose on third party clients, but I'll report just in case. After a few tweets in a row (4 to be specific in this case), the next tweet gets refused by Twitter with "Error 150: you cannot send messages to users who are not following you". To be clear, the message contains no @ mentions. I'll add a screenshot to s illustrate the issue.
Manager.title: Error 150: you cannot send messages to users who are not following you

Manager.description: I've downloaded Twidere for the first time, and "remember position" does not work on lists tabs (it does in the timeline tab). v 3.2.7 Android 6.0.1 OnePlus 3
Manager.title: Remember position setting doesn't work on lists tabs

Manager.description: Bear with me, it is probably a Twidere integration issue :) So when Twitter sends you an email about people favouriting and following or whatever, the email has a link in it. So I open the Gmail app to read the mail and occasionally want to go to the user profile for example. Even if I ask my Android 5 to open such a link with Twidere, it will open my default browser (which happens to be Opera), and the URL will change from https://mobile.twitter.com/… to something starting with twitter:// which in turn can, I guess, only be understood by the official Twitter app. So multiple issues/questions here: why doesn't or cannot Twidere get associated with the link in the first place? can Twidere learn to hook onto twitter:// "protocol" and do the right thing? (why on Earth is Twitter such an a-hole about third party clients?)
Manager.title: Can't open links in email notifications

Manager.description: How do you add a generic search tab? I can't seem to find a way to add a search option which would allow you to click on it, type in what you want to search for i.e. users, hashtags etc and be displayed with a list of results. To me being able to search Twitter is vital in order to fully utilise it. I would find it strange that something so generic wouldn't be included in this app. 👍 1
Manager.title: Generic Search tab

Manager.description: I have 22 lists on my Twitter account, but 2 do not show up in the list presented by Twidere when I select "add to list". I can add a new list and then temporarily, 21 lists will be shown, but upon the next opening, it'll be back to 20. I thus think there's a hard limit and I don't really see a reason for that. Do you?
Manager.title: Twidere only shows 20 lists in "add to list" dialog

Manager.description: Twidere seems to allow you to copy the text of a tweet, but not just the URL by itself. If I go to the Share option, it will share the URL but it will copy the text of the tweet along with the URL. I want a way to copy ONLY the URL. In Twitter's official mobile app you can simply select "Copy link to tweet" and it does that just fine. Is there no way to do that in Twidere, or am I simply overlooking it? I love Twidere, but this is an option I've really been missing.
Manager.title: Copy ONLY the Tweet's URL?

Manager.description: I'm using Twidere with a friend which is not really experienced using Twitter. So I'm helping him to organize his Twitter experience with some tweets written by me. But we want to ensure that all tweets are identifiable which are written from him. So it would be a nice feature to configure Twidere with a function to add a suffix/prefix to every written tweet like "This is a tweet from User XY! /xy" (the suffix is "/xy" here).
Manager.title: [Feature Request] Configuring to include a prefix/suffix to every tweet

Manager.description: Please excuse my mess English. I can't tweet a message from several days ago. When I try to tweet, it shows a blank error message, and saves the message in the draft. At first, I doubted API error because the problem began with the update of Twitter for Android (the official twitter app for android) and I'm using Twidere with custom OAuth (of Twitter for Android). But still I can do everything (including retweet, favorite, etc.) except tweet, so I thought that may not be a key cause of this problem. I'm using Android KitKat 4.4.2 (LG Optimus G2) Thank you.
Manager.title: [BUG] Can not tweet a message

My device is a low-end phone w/ 1GB RAM, so even a few background tasks tends to make it slow down pretty quickly. AndStatus uses Android's built-in sync, but Twidere has so many more features (plus I like Twidere's UI better).
Manager.title: Use Android's built-in account sync

Manager.description: I've got a tab showing all tweets of a specific user. Whenever I want to visit the profile of any other user who's been retweeted into this timeline by tapping on that other user's avatar, I get this screen, loading forever: This problem does persist even when navigating through the thread of the retweeted tweet, tapping tweets and then the avatar... it persists through the whole possible action tree starting at the tab showing the tweets of a specific user (as far as I tested). Steps to reproduce: Add a tab "tweets of specific user" (e.g. "@kiforbiter", which is a retweet bot) Pick any retweet in that tab and try to visit the retweeted user's profile. Actual behavior: I see the screen above. Expected behaviour: I see the retweeted user's profile. In tabs of a different type, everything's working fine. Using Twidere 3.2.9 on Nexus 5/Android 5.1.1.
Manager.title: Can't view profile of RT'd user in a "tweets of user" tab

Manager.description: When I copy the link of a retweeted tweet, Twidere copies the link to the retweet, rather than to the original tweet. Example: The copied link: https://mobile.twitter.com/BillGates/status/852499734728253440 (notice the 'Zaq Retweeted' title on top) Original tweet link: https://mobile.twitter.com/BillGates/status/851768550616420353 (can be obtained by clicking on the tweet's timestamp) This behaviour poses two issues: Usually user wants to share the tweet itself, not the fact that someone retweeted it. I believe this is a far more common use case A far more serious one - if the account of the user who retweeted the tweet is private (followers-only), the shared link becomes useless - you cannot share it with friends, it won't open in the browser. Same private-retweets issue manifests in related features. E.g. 'open in browser' command fails if the user is not logged into twitter in their browser. 'Share' suffers the same issue too. I think it would be a lot more practical if all these features provided the link with the original tweet id, not the retweet id. Android version: 6.0.1 (CM) App version: 3.5.13 Build variant: Google F-Droid Micro-blogging service: Twitter Fanfou GNU Social / StatusNet App settings: Custom API Custom consumer key/secrets Official keys Using Thumbor Connected through proxy Media preview enabled
Manager.title: Copy Link/Share features copy the retweeted url

Manager.description: First off, a rather meta complaint: Why is reply-to-self handled with a completely different subroutine than other replys in Twidere? I can tell there's separate rules for reply-to-self due to how many issues I have had in the past few months just in that area that didn't affect other replies. There's no reason to treat them differently on the composition end afaik unless Twitter's own API has different areas to send the requests to. The receiving end is different, obviously, since the notifications timeline needs to filter them out. If the composition does indeed require a complete set of separate rules for replying to self, I would enjoy an explanation as to why since it currently makes no sense to me. But anyway, the issue I'm having this time is that I noticed you fixed the removal of users from the list by just removing the @ name in the compose box. However, as of 3.5.16, it doesn't apply this to reply-to-self compositions. In fact, it does the opposite. It actually replies with all users mentioned getting ADDED IN ADDITION TO the list of participants, which means it counts it towards the tweet character limit and will end up duplicating the participants list in Twidere and show the handles within the tweet itself on the official channels. Edited to shorten the rant on the meta issue for the past few bug reports I've filed. I repeat myself a lot, unfortunately, kinda like the meta issue itself. Sorry. 😅
Manager.title: [Bug] Replying to self receives different treatment with mentions

Manager.description: Since some time I noticed that the author of a post was often displayed wrong when working with Friendica. I think the cause is this code: Twidere-Android/twidere.component.common/src/main/java/org/mariotaku/microblog/library/twitter/model/Status.java Line 99 in 0a3a5b1 @JsonField(name = {"user", "friendica_owner"}) The field "friendica_owner" is not the same as the "user" field. The "user" is always the author that should be displayed, while the "friendica_owner" is only of some interest with forum posts. Then it would make sense to show both "user" and "friendica_owner" at the same time. The easiest solution is to not display the "friendica_owner" at all.
Manager.title: "friendica_owner" is not the same like "user"

On this screenshot, the Android notification is about a mention I've received already, the counter on the icon in Twidere bar is correct (I have no new event indeed, but a notification is displayed anyway). If there are new events, the counter in Twidere bar will be correct (say, 5) but the Android notification will show one more event (6 in this case). The wrongly counted event may be from any account, and sometimes one notification from each account is wrongly counted. So it is an off-by-one error for each account, which may result in several Android notifications wrongly displayed. Extra info I know the Mastodon account works because I can see the local toots in the Public Timeline and the Network Timeline. Okay, I just tried again and it seems I can see toots in the Home view when I open Twidere with the Mastodon account already selected (at the phone's first start). In this case it's this time the tweets which don't display in the Home view. My Twitter and Mastodon accounts are exactly the same name (@KillianKemps), maybe is it there a conflict. Manager.description: Twitter develops their own set of Creative Commons-licensed emoji graphics: https://github.com/twitter/twemoji Unlike Android, where users are dependent on OEMs to ship updates for new Unicode versions, Twemoji is constantly being updated. They are also used by Twitter for their hashflags feature. For details see http://emojipedia.org/twitter/ Bundling Twemoji would give users a consistent Twitter experience across formfactors. It would also ensure that users don't get to see a placeholder, just because their phone is one year old.
Manager.title: Bundle Twemoji

Manager.description: In the API for the settings of the node (located at /api/statusnet/config.xml on every GNU social or Statusnet instance) there is an entry called file_quota. You can find it in the XML tree under config > attachments > file_quota and it shows the allowed file size in Bytes. I think it'd be nice if Twidere could read this value and warn the user if he is about to send a bigger attachment as allowed. The current behavior is that the post is submitted as normal, but the attachment is missing and the user notices this only afterwards. And I sometimes wondered why the image is missing although I intended to (and did) add one… 😉 Edit: Of course there is also JSON, e.g.: curl https://gnusocial.de/api/statusnet/config.json | jq .attachments.file_quota
Manager.title: Detect the allowed file size for attachments in GNU social

Manager.description: Expected behavior All users in reply should have their instance address tacked on the end. In Pleroma, this is always needed, whereas in GNU Social it's not always needed. In the above screenshot, it should read... @USBHump@masto.dog @gooz@shitposter.club @natecull@mastodon.social Actual behavior The user to whom I am directly replying has their instance tacked on twice. The other users don't have their instances at all. Steps to reproduce Create an account on a pleroma instance. I am https://pleroma.soykaf.com/users/gooz Log in to it in Twidere (using the GNU Social API) 2a. In Twidere, go to the add-account dialog and select any server from the Statusnet dropdown. 2b. Enter the "Edit API" dialog at the top 2c. Change the URL to https://pleroma.soykaf.com/api (change for whatever instance you signed up on) 2d. Change auth type to Basic 2e. Enter user/pass as normal and finish logging in. Reply to a notice in a thread. See the screenshots attached at the top Extra info I am logged into a Pleroma instance, using the GNU Social API. I know Pleroma isn't GNU Social, but the api still works and I can log into the account and post things in Twidere. Maybe in order to solve this, you can make a modified version of the statusnet mode for pleroma instances. Or maybe there can be added a toggle-option in the Twidere settings to add the instance address to the end of all users. On pleroma, all users do need their addresses tacked on in order to make the reply work. Not just mastodon users or users that you're not following. All users. Android version: 7.1.2 NZH54B Network type: Cellular Wi-Fi App version: 3.6.21 Build variant: Google F-Droid Micro-blogging service: Twitter Fanfou GNU Social / StatusNet Mastodon App settings: Custom API Custom consumer key/secrets Official keys Using Thumbor Connected through proxy Media preview enabled
Manager.title: Pleroma mentions don't work right.

Manager.description: When RTing from one platform to another (eg. from Twitter to GNU Social), Twidere will grab a link to the attachment where it is on the original platform. At least for some kinds of attachments, like images most importantly, I think it would be a good idea for Twidere to download the image(s) and upload them as attachments when tweeting to the destination platform, rather than just linking to the first one. Off the top of my head, this gives us two benefits. If the original tweet gets deleted or censored, the RT on GNU Social will still be intact. Users on GNU Social can view the attachments without sending traffic back to Twitter and perhaps being tracked when they don't want to be.
Manager.title: [Feature Request] RTs from one platform to another (Attachments)

Manager.description: I noticed that the last release, 3.6.24, is only available in the develop branch, it's not yet included in master. This is a problem because F-Droid's notion of current version depends on the latest available manifest versioncode in the master branch. This means even after the build was manually added for 3.6.24 the current version was reset by the build-bot to 3.6.23 on the next run. Can you merge develop into master before you make a new release? Or is 3.6.24 actually dev release (But I see no other indication of that)? (Normally fdroid checks for available tags in the git repo, but this doesn't work for twidere for reasons I've not completely understood. It always picks the wrong subfolder and ends up with some version 1.0)
Manager.title: Merge develop into master for fdroids updatecheck to work

I also noticed that a wrapper method that handles the deprecation problem for these APIs has been implemented in CookieManagerExtension.kt. I am just wondering why not just use this wrapper method? Thx.

Manager.description: I have a scenario where I have two accounts. There are some cases where there is still an overlap in who I follow. There are some cases where I don't want to remove this overlap. I am perfectly fine with seeing the same tweet/retweet twice, but currently there is no way of knowing which account the tweet is associated with. This causes an issue if I want to reply, like, or retweet. The current setup says that the first account that is logged in will come first, so I can partially get around this, but there is absolutely no distinction between a tweet that has no overlap (One of my accounts doesn't follow the tweeter). An example: Account Foo and Bar are my accounts. Foo and Bar have some overlapping accounts that they both follow. Foo follows these accounts: Ayy Bee See Bar follows these accounts: Dee Bee See Account "Ayy" submits a tweet. Account "Bee" submits a tweet. I want to retweet the tweet from Bee to my Bar account. My timeline now looks like this: --- Bee: This is a picture of my cat (Media) Reply, Retweet, Like --- --- Bee: This is a picture of my cat (Media) Reply, Retweet, Like --- --- Ayy: I like cats Reply, Retweet, Like --- There is no distinction in any of these tweets which account of mine it originates from. The only reason I know Ayy's tweet is from Foo is because Bar does not follow Ayy. It is entirely up to guessing and checking to figure out which of the tweets from Bee corresponds to account Bar. This makes it difficult to like, retweet, or reply.
Manager.title: Add which account the Tweet's follower comes from

Manager.description: For users with protected twitter accounts, it's possible to see a list of pending follow requests, but it's not possible to do anything with them. Would be great if each item in the list had an 'Approve' and 'Deny' button, so you could manage pending follow requests right from within the app.
